news.author: Tierney Bricker
news.title: Exclusive: The 100's New Trailer Warns to Prepare for War
news.eonline:summary: Exclusive: Clarke is on the run and Lincoln is convinced the truth will break in the CW hit's latest promo for its Jan. 21 return

eonline:images.title: The 100
eonline:images.caption:
Eliza Taylor talked about Clarke's surprising evolution over the course of the series thus far on the panel, saying, "It has evolved to my surprise. Constantly not knowing where the story is going...every day I get to work and I get to learn and grow with this character." 

And Clarke isn't the only character learning and growing in season three, as a devastated Jasper (Devon Bostick) is still having a hard time dealing with Maya's death in the season two finale and Raven (Lindsey Morgan) is putting on a tough front about her leg injury...but not everyone is buying her act. 

And it looks like that truce with the Grounders might not be a long-lasting one, as Lincoln (Ricky Whittle) warns "the truce will break and we'll be at war" in the promo. On the panel, showrunner Jason Rothenberg teased fans will learn more about the Grounders in season three, saying, "We tell a lot of stories in [the Grounder capitol] Polis this season," adding there may or may not be a "civil war brewing" there as well. 

The 100 season three premieres Thursday, Jan. 21 at 9 p.m. on the CW.

news.author: Seija Rankin
news.title: Amy Schumer and Jennifer Lawrence's Best Golden Globes BFF Moments
news.eonline:summary: These two are inseparable, even at awards shows.

eonline:images.title: Jennifer Lawrence, Amy Schumer, Golden Globe Awards
eonline:images.caption:
2015 was the year of Jennifer Lawrence and Amy Schumer's newfound friendship, and it seems that mutual girl crush isn't going anywhere this year. Exhibit A? Tonight's Golden Globe Awards.

The show's producers may have done their best to keep the two off-camera (seriously, couldn't we have gotten a few more cut-aways?), presumably for fear of the two causing distracting (and amazing) hijinks, but that didn't stop them from drumming up some much-needed raucous.  After all, it's not in their nature to stand idly by—especially at an awards show with unlimited booze. 

It all started on the red carpet. Kind of. Schumer showed up with her sister (or #RoadManager as she's tenderly known on social media) Kim Caramele, and Lawrence hit the interview line with her Joy director and general life mentor David O. Russell. Sure, we were all collectively hoping that Jen and Amy would walk the carpet together (possibly while wearing some type of conjoined-twin outfit), but they did manage to give each other a few shout-outs. 

Our favorite? Amy's excitement at seeing her new BFF in a decidedly glammed-up setting. "It'll be weird to see her in a Hollywood setting," she joked. "We're usually in sweatpants and bras and writing."

eonline:images.title: JLaw and Amy GIFs
eonline:images.caption: The entire thing basically read like an audition tape for next year's Golden Globes hosting gig, and we wouldn't want it any other way. From their attempt to find Schumer a celebrity nickname as good as JLaw (A-Schu? Aim-Tom Hardy? Aim-All-The-Hemsworthses?) to their genius riffing ("Dreams. Helping children. World peace. Cars. Medicine.") to their subtle reminders of why we should love them ("[People] are just like, oh, you're so pretty and everyone likes them and wants to hang out with them and, like, they seem so fun to be around and, like, oh, they should be models."), it was a lesson to all future presenters on exactly what to do.

eonline:images.title: JLaw and Amy GIFs
eonline:images.caption: The night had the potential to take an awkward turn when the Best Actress in a Musical or Comedy category came up, seeing as the BFFs were pitted against each other and Amy was favored to win by a number of people, but they handled it with grace and a tableside hug. And a dedicated Instagram post, of course.

news.e:description:
Once they made it inside the venue, they were lucky enough to be seated at the same table (even though their other bestie Brie Larson wasn't quite as lucky!), which gave them the ability to cheer each other on throughout the night. First up? JLaw's mention in host Ricky Gervais' monologue. As he gave her a shout-out for making the news when she demanded equal pay for women in Hollywood, good ol' Amy stoop up and cheered "Yeah, Jen!" at the top of her lungs, accompanied by a flurry of claps and whoops. They both later had a good laugh when Gervais delivered the second half of the joke: "She received overwhelming support from people everywhere. There were marches on the street with nurses and factory workers saying, how the hell can a 25-year-old live on $52 million?"

Then came the moment we'd all been waiting for: Their awards presentation.

news.author: Jenna Mullins
news.title: 10 Reasons the Golden Globes Were an Ode to the '90s
news.eonline:summary: Childhood crushes Christian Slater, Leonardo DiCaprio and so much crushed velvet ruled the night

eonline:images.title: Leonardo Dicaprio, Kate Winslet, 2016 Golden Globes
eonline:images.caption:
Was it just us or did it seem like we were smack dab in the middle of the ‘90s while watching Sunday's Golden Globes? Are we back in the greatest decade of all time?! Someone bring us our Tamagotchis, our poster of Jonathan Taylor Thomas and our taped episode of Legends of the Hidden Temple!

We're talking about you favorite ‘90s heartthrobs, your favorite ‘90s fashions and a ‘90s movie couple reunion that made you long for the days of seeing Titanic four times in the theater, all in one night. It's official; the 2016 Golden Globes were essentially an ode to the ‘90s. Just look at the evidence:

1. Christian Slater's big night

eonline:images.title: Christian Slater, Golden Globes Winners
eonline:images.caption:
He's been in the business for years and years, but with Mr. Robot's hype and his big win last night, Slater hasn't been this relevant and hip since you kissed his poster every night before going to bed in 1995.

2. So much crushed velvet on the carpet

eonline:images.title: Lady Gaga, Golden Globe Awards
eonline:images.caption: You can't talk about the ‘90s without talking about velvet, you guys. And that trend was all over the place last night.

eonline:images.title: Brad Pitt, Ryan Gosling, Golden Globes
eonline:images.caption:
It was worthy of a Teen Beat magazine centerfold.

4. Sylvester Stallone's big win

eonline:images.title: Sylvester Stallone, Golden Globe Awards
eonline:images.caption:
He was the action star of the ‘90s, and you could not enter a movie theater without passing a movie poster featuring Sly with some kind of explosion in the background. Last night, he was back in the spotlight for his return to the world of Rocky Balboa.

5. Kate Winslet and Leonardo DiCaprio reuniting

eonline:images.title: Kate Winslet, Leonardo Dicaprio, 2016 Golden Globes GIF
eonline:images.caption:
You know you shipped Kate and Leo so hard after seeing Titanic. Seeing Jack Dawson and Rose DeWitt Bukater hugging each other during the Globes brought us right back to 1996 as we sobbed along to "My Heart Will Go On" during the credits. Speaking of Mr. DiCaprio...

6. Leo just won the entire night

eonline:images.title: Golden Globes best moments GIFs
eonline:images.caption: He won a Golden Globe. He broke the Internet by merely hugging a former costar. And he was the star of the moment that launched a thousand GIFs (the reaction to Lady Gaga). Back in the ‘90s, Leo was your fantasy boyfriend and he was so in. In 2016, he's now your fantasy husband who hopefully will finally get that long overdue Oscar.

eonline:images.title: Kate Hudson, Golden Globe Awards, Candids
eonline:images.caption:
The dress. The hair. Kate Hudson was peak ‘90s last night on the carpet and she slayed it.

8. Another ‘90s dreamboat had a big night

eonline:images.title: Matt Damon, Golden Globe Awards, Winners
eonline:images.caption:
We're talking about Matt Damon, y'all! Everyone wanted to be the cheese in a Matt Damon-Ben Affleck sandwich back in 1998. And wouldn't you know it, Ben and Matt's long-running bro-ship came up last night.

9. Taraji P. Henson gave herself a catchphrase

eonline:images.title: Taraji P. Henson, Will Smith, Golden Globes GIF
eonline:images.caption:
"Did I do that?" "Not the mamma!" "How rude!" The ‘90s gave us a plethora of catchphrases that still haunt us to this day. And when Henson won a Globe for her role on Empire, she not only referenced that she's been waiting since the ‘90s for her time onstage, but she kind of gave herself a catchphrase: "You gonna wait!" And Will Smith, another '90s icon, loved her for it.

10. Channing Tatum's late ‘90s emo hairstyle

eonline:images.title: Channing Tatum, Jenna Dewan Tatum, Golden Globe Awards Couples
eonline:images.caption:
Not much to say after presenting the above photo. He looks like the lead singer of the band whose lyrics constantly pop up in your angst-y AIM away message. 

Fingers crossed that this ‘90s trend continues for the Oscars! Maybe someone will bring back those teeny tiny butterfly clips. Lookin' at you, Brie Larson…

news.author: Kendall Fisher
news.title: Brooklyn Decker Spent the Golden Globes Breastfeeding: See the Pic!
news.eonline:summary: Model missed out on 2016 Golden Globes

eonline:images.title: Brooklyn Decker, Breastfeeding, Instagram
eonline:images.caption:
Instead of putting on a fancy dress and expensive jewelry, Brooklyn Decker spent the 2016 Golden Globes doing other important things…like, you know, breastfeeding her newborn baby!

The model—who welcomed her first child into the world in October—took to Instagram to joke about her less than glamorous night, pulling her hair back and wearing an oversized t-shirt while sharing a makeup-free breastfeeding photo with one of the most hilarious captions we've ever read.

"#notgoldenglobes," she commented alongside the pic with her baby boy. "#mykidsuckingonagoldenglobetho."

LOL! She's got that right!

news.e:description: Meanwhile, Andy Roddick's wife wasn't alone in missing the Globes. Stars like Kim Kardashian, Wendy Williams, Mindy Kaling and more spent the evening tweeting from their couches, too:

news.author: Billy Nilles
news.title: Exclusive! Stassi's Back in This Vanderpump Rules Superteaser
news.eonline:summary: Exclusive! Check out's still to come the rest of this season on the Bravo reality hit

eonline:images.title: Stassi Schroeder, Lisa Vanderpump, Vanderpump Rules
eonline:images.caption:
"I hate you, I hate you, I hate you. Go f--k yourself and die." Stassi Schroeder, ladies and gentlemen.

That's right, everyone's favorite Vanderpump Rules blonde baddie is making her return to the hit Bravo series and in this extended trailer for the second half of the season, exclusive to E! News before airing following tonight's new episode, it may not be such a triumphant one.

If the California drought could be solved using tears, someone ought to have followed Stassi around as she attempted to make good with former co-stars Tom Schwartz, Katie Maloney and her old boss Lisa Vanderpump because the waterworks were a-flowing. "You had a boss and a good friend," Queen Lisa tells her former subject. "And you f--ked it up."
